title: Bug 18934 Scrollbars should be disabled in ImageAnalyzer example
description: ImageAnalyzer example in Build F2 (20020602) on Redhat 7.2 with GTK2KDE 2.210 (GTK2 only) exhibits an issue with enabled but non-functional scrollbars. When opening the ImageAnalyzer example, the scrollbars are enabled and can be moved, but they do not have any effect. This behavior is misleading, especially when opening small images such as icons, as the scrollbars do not perform any action.
OB: ImageAnalyzer example in Build F2 (20020602) on Redhat 7.2 with GTK2KDE 2.210 (GTK2 only) exhibits enabled but non-functional scrollbars. The scrollbars can be moved around, but they do not have any effect.
EB: In the ImageAnalyzer example, the scrollbars should be disabled when opening small images, such as icons, on Build F2 (20020602) on Redhat 7.2 with GTK2KDE 2.210 (GTK2 only).
SR:
1. Launch the ImageAnalyzer example in Build F2 (20020602) on Redhat 7.2 with GTK2KDE 2.210 (GTK2 only).
2. Open a small image, like an icon.
3. Observe that the scrollbars are enabled and can be moved, but they do not have any effect.
